protocol.text: Seven-day-old seedlings were transferred from agar plates of control media to agar plates of fresh control media (water potential -0.25 MPa) or low water potential agar plates (-1.2 MPa).  Low water potential plates were prepared by overlaying a solution of polyethylene glycol (molecular weight 8000) on the control agar plates and equilibrating overnight.  Details of PEG-agar plate preparation can be found in Verslues et al., Plant J 45:523-539 2006.  After transfer to treatment plates, seedlings were returned to growth chamber for 96 h before sample collection.

Seedlings were grown on agar plates containing half-strength MS salts and 2 mM MES buffer. No sugar was added to the media.  Plates were positioned vertically for seeding growth along the surface of the agar and were kept in a growth chamber at 25 C, continuous light at 85-100 micromol photons m-2 sec-1 and high (80-90%) relative humidity.
Total RNA was extracted using the RNeasy Plant Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer's protocol.
Biotinylated cRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from 10 ug total RNA (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 701021 Rev. 5, Affymetrix).
Following fragmentation, 10 ug of cRNA were hybridized for 16.5 hr at 45C on the GeneChip ATH1 Genome Array. GeneChips were washed and stained in the Affymetrix Fluidics Station 450.
GeneChips were scanned using Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000 7G.

The data were analyzed with Microarray Suite version 5.0 (MAS 5.0) using Affymetrix default analysis settings and global scaling as normalization method. The trimmed mean target intensity of each array was arbitrarily set to 500.
